points.title: The court of law governing the terms is in location X
points.status: The Terms and Conditions state "You agree that any claim, action, or proceeding arising out of these Terms and Conditions, or your use of the U.S. News Services, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York applicable to contracts to be wholly performed therein, and any action based on or alleging a breach of this Agreement must be brought exclusively in a state or federal court located in New York County, New York. In addition, you agree to submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts."

points.title: There is a date of the last update of the agreements
points.status: The Terms and conditions state "Last updated August 5, 2020."

points.title: Do Not Track (DNT) headers are ignored and you are tracked anyway even if you set this header.
points.status: The privacy policy states "Because an industry-standard Do-Not-Track protocol has not yet been established, we currently do not recognize any browser signals as “do not track” or “do not sell” requests."

points.title: You can opt out of promotional communications
points.status: The Privacy Policy states "If you decide that you do not wish to receive email communications from U.S. News and others, you may opt-out of receiving further commercial emails and other communications by clicking "Unsubscribe" or "Manage my email preferences" in any email. Please note that if you opt-out of receiving further commercial emails, you may still receive transactional emails."

points.title: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction
points.status: The privacy policy states "In addition, U.S. News may disclose information we maintain (A) if in good faith we believe that such disclosure is necessary to (1) comply with the law or legal process; (2) protect and defend our rights and property; (3) protect against misuse or unauthorized use of the U.S. News Services; or (4) protect the personal safety, property, or rights of our users or the public, or (B) in connection with a corporate transaction, such as a divestiture, merger, consolidation, or asset sale."

points.title: This service tracks which web page referred you to it
points.status: The Privacy Policy states "U.S. News may also collect information that does not identify you by name when you visit the U.S. News Services, such as your internet protocol ("IP") address, geo-location, domain name, browser configuration, device type, unique device identifier, the type of operating system you are using, information about your Internet service provider, the time of your visit, whether you are a returning visitor, and any referring website."

points.title: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service
points.status: The Terms and Conditions state "U.S. News does not warrant or make any representations regarding the use or the results of the use of the materials on the U.S. News Services in terms of their correctness, accuracy, timeliness, reliability, or otherwise."

points.title: The service is provided 'as is' and to be used at your sole risk
points.status: The Terms and Conditions state "The materials and tools contained on the U.S. News Services are provided by U.S. News as a service to you for your noncommercial, personal use on an "as is, as available" basis and may be used by you for informational purposes only."

points.title: This service is only available for use individually and non-commercially.
points.status: The Terms and Conditions state "The materials and tools contained on the U.S. News Services are provided by U.S. News as a service to you for your noncommercial, personal use"

points.title: Instead of asking directly, this Service will assume your consent merely from your usage.
points.status: The Terms and Conditions state "Continued access to the U.S. News Services by you will constitute your acceptance of any changes or revisions to these Terms and Conditions."
